alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 07 at 8:58AM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Warrick, Gibson and west central Pike Counties through 830 AM CDT/930 AM EDT/... At 758 AM CDT/858 AM EDT/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Princeton, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Patoka around 805 AM CDT. Princeton around 810 AM CDT. Fort Branch around 815 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Oakland City. This includes the following highways... Interstate 69 in Indiana between Mile Markers 23 and 41. Interstate 64 in Indiana between Mile Markers 33 and 35. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
